Ω(...).html() This function will return the innerHTML of a element if the Ω(...).html() function value is null or will set the innerHTML of the element if some value is given like Ω(...).html("Some value"). Example for getting innerHTML of a element 
      <a-sentence>This is some innerHTML</a-sentence>
      <submit-btn>Submit</submit-btn>
   
      Ω('#check-btn').on('click', ()=>{
      alert(Ω('#a-sentence').html());   
      });
See the demo This is some innerHTML Submit To set the html of a element 
            <one-sentence>This is original innerHTML</one-sentence>
            <check-btn>Change innerHTML</check-btn>
         
            Ω('#check-btn').on('click', ()=>{
               Ω('#a-sentence').html("Change innerHTML");  
               });
See the demo This is some innerHTML Change innerHTML
